Highlights

<BananaSlider/>

BananaSlider is a library built in pure JavaScript, is a very easy and customizable way to create slides (carrousel's) with total control over it.

Take a look

<PipocaJS/>

Version fixer and incrementer for JavaScript and Git repositories, just type "pipoca" and you can forget to increment your package version... This works watching commits and yours messages.

Take a look

jsPaths.code:
import { initAllSliders  } from './node_modules/bananaslider/dist/bundle.es.js'
import { initAllParallax } from './node_modules/pasteljs/index.js'
initAllSliders()
initAllParallax()

<Welcome/>

JS

HTML

CSS

Just a look

Open Source

You will reach open source library here

Multi Language

Projects in multiple languages and platforms

From dev for dev

Get libraries to make your work a little bit more easy

Different projects

See some projects with one screw less

Highlights

<BananaSlider/>

BananaSlider is a library built in pure JavaScript, is a very easy and customizable way to create slides (carrousel's) with total control over it.

Take a look

<PipocaJS/>

Version fixer and incrementer for JavaScript and Git repositories, just type "pipoca" and you can forget to increment your package version... This works watching commits and yours messages.

Take a look

<Juca/>

Juca is a template engine, built to automate repetitive and non-intuitive processes of implementing Javascript directly in the look of your HTML. This works on the client side, your server will send the pure html source code to the client, in the act of loading Juca, this will generate all the HTML, this works without any framework, just pure Javascript and HTML.

Take a look

By Kruceo

        @import url('https://fonts.googleapis.com/css?family=Karla');
    </style>

jsPaths.code:
import { initAllSliders  } from './node_modules/bananaslider/dist/bundle.es.js'
import { initAllParallax } from './node_modules/pasteljs/index.js'
initAllSliders()
initAllParallax()

This works on the client side, your server will send the pure html source code to the client, in the act of loading Juca, this will generate all the HTML, this works without any framework, just pure Javascript and HTML.

Take a look

<Orkrux/>

Orkrux as created for generate SPA's, originaly to reuse standart HTML's pages.

Take a look

By Kruceo
html.head:
<route></route>
    <meta charset='utf-8'>
    <meta http-equiv='X-UA-Compatible' content='IE=edge'>

    <title>Kruceo | Main</title>
    <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0">
    <link rel='stylesheet' type='text/css' media='screen' href='main.css'>
    <style>
        @import url('https://fonts.googleapis.com/css?family=Karla');
    </style>

jsPaths.code:
import { initAllSliders  } from './node_modules/bananaslider/dist/bundle.es.js'
import { initAllParallax } from './node_modules/pasteljs/index.js'
initAllSliders()
initAllParallax()

>Main

>Projects

>Info

  • Main

  • Projects

  • Info

<Welcome/>

JS

HTML

CSS

Just a look

Open Source

You will reach open source library here

Multi Language

Projects in multiple languages and platforms

From dev for dev

Get libraries to make your work a little bit more easy

Different projects

See some projects with one screw less

Highlights

<BananaSlider/>

BananaSlider is a library built in pure JavaScript, is a very easy and customizable way to create slides (carrousel's) with total control over it.

Take a look

<Juca/>

Juca is a template engine, built to automate repetitive and non-intuitive processes of implementing Javascript directly in the look of your HTML. This works on the client side, your server will send the pure html source code to the client, in the act of loading Juca, this will generate all the HTML, this works without any framework, just pure Javascript and HTML.

Take a look

<Orkrux/>

Orkrux as created for generate SPA's, originaly to reuse standart HTML's pages.

Take a look

By Kruceo
